resources.string: Cookbook
400g spaghetti, 4 cloves garlic (sliced), 1/2 cup olive oil, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, salt, fresh parsley (chopped), grated Parmesan (optional).

Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente, reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain. In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat, add garlic and sauté until golden, then add red pepper flakes and cook for another minute. Toss spaghetti in the pan, adding reserved pasta water as needed, season with salt, garnish with parsley, and serve with Parmesan.
500g chicken (diced), 1 onion (chopped), 2 cloves garlic (minced), 1-inch ginger (grated), 2 cups coconut milk, 2 tbsp curry powder, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, pepper, fresh cilantro (for garnish).

Heat oil in a pot over medium heat, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until softened, then add chicken and brown on all sides. Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute, pour in coconut milk, season with salt and pepper, and simmer for 20 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.
2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots), 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 clove garlic (minced), 1-inch ginger (grated), cooked rice (for serving).

Heat sesame oil in a pan over high heat, add garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp, then add soy sauce and toss to combine. Serve over rice.
3 large tomatoes (sliced), 250g fresh mozzarella (sliced), fresh basil leaves, 1/4 cup olive oil, balsamic vinegar (optional), salt, pepper.
Layer tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, tuck basil leaves in between, drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar, and season with salt and pepper.
500g ground beef or chicken, 1 packet taco seasoning, taco shells, toppings (lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream).
Cook the meat in a pan until browned, add taco seasoning, and follow packet instructions. Fill taco shells with meat and top with your choice of toppings.
1 cup flour, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 cup milk, 1 egg, 2 tbsp melted butter.

In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, whisk milk, egg, and melted butter, then combine wet and dry ingredients. Cook on a greased skillet until bubbles form, then flip.
500g beef (sliced thin), 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli), 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 clove garlic (minced), cooked rice (for serving).
Heat oil in a pan over high heat, add garlic and beef, and stir-fry until browned. Add vegetables and soy sauce, stir-fry until vegetables are tender, and serve over rice.
1 onion (chopped), 2 carrots (diced), 2 celery stalks (diced), 2 cups diced tomatoes, 1 can kidney beans, 4 cups vegetable broth, 1 cup pasta, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper.
Sauté onion, carrots, and celery in a pot until softened, then add tomatoes, broth, beans, and pasta. Season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper, and simmer until pasta is cooked. Serve hot.
1 cup butter (softened), 1 cup sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 2 eggs, 2 tsp vanilla extract, 3 cups flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 cups chocolate chips.

Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Cream butter and sugars together, beat in eggs and vanilla. Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, then gradually add to the wet mixture. Stir in chocolate chips, drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet, and bake for 10-12 minutes.
2 cups Greek yogurt, 1 cup granola, 2 cups mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), honey (optional).
In a glass, layer Greek yogurt, granola, and berries, then drizzle with honey if desired. Repeat layers and serve.
